content: pick up 1 st for every st in the slipped st edge along the sides of the hood 2 sts for every 3 edge sts along the decrease sections and 1 st for every bobble st at the bottom of the front opening pm for bor round 1 and 2 *k1 p1* repeat to end of round using mc round 3 *k1 p1* repeat to end of round using cc round 4 *k1 p1* repeat to end of round using mc round 5 *k1 p1* repeat 26 times ssk yo *k1 p1* repeat 7 times k1 yo k2tog p1 *k1 p1* repeat to end of round using mc round 6 *k1 p1* repeat to end of round using cc round 7-16 *k1 p1* repeat to end of round using mc fold the brim double and attach it by binding off the stitches while picking up yarn at the base of the rib alternatively you can bind off sts fold the brim and sew it down i-cord drawstring using 4 mm needles and long tail cast-on co 3 sts i-cord repeat k3 slip worked sts back to the left needle repeat until string measures 110 cm 43 in when slightly stretched finishing weave in all ends wet block the hood making sure to stretch the neck ribbing to approximately the same circumference as the brioche section try not to stretch the brioche stitch especially horizontally to maintain its deep texture wet block the i-cord string by hanging it allowing it to stretch under its own weight when dried pull the string into the brim luti hood by anna dębska 5 abbreviations k knit p purl brk brioche knit brp brioche purl sl1yo slip 1 yarn over yo yarn over ssk slip slip knit k2tog knit 2 together l-decrease left leaning brioche decrease r-decrease right leaning brioche decrease pm place marker rm remove marker bor beginning of the round repeat repeat bobble bind off co cast on st/sts stitch / stitches mc main colour cc contrast colour luti hood by anna dębska 6
